avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the occasionally moderate southwesterly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form on Tuesday. Especially in the border areas with France. The fresh wind slabs will be deposited on unfavourable layers in all aspects. These are mostly rather small but can in some cases be released easily, in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. This applies in particular on very steep slopes.
In isolated cases avalanches can penetrate down to the ground.
Natural dry avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they will be mostly small.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Little snow fell on Saturday in some localities. Up to 15 cm of snow will fall above approximately 2000 m. On Tuesday the wind will be moderate at times in some localities.
In some places wind slabs are lying on a weakly bonded old snowpack.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface.
Steep sunny slopes: Underneath the fresh snow there is a more or less load-bearing refreezing crust.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Dry avalanches can be released in very isolated cases. In particular transitions into gullies and bowls where weaknesses exist in the old snowpack are unfavourable, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare and are difficult to recognise.
Individual mostly small natural avalanches are possible, in particular on extreme slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack can still be released in isolated cases.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 5 cm of snow will fall above approximately 2000 m. In some localities 5 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 2000 m.
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface. Weak layers exist in the old snowpack.
Steep sunny slopes: Underneath the fresh snow there is a more or less load-bearing refreezing crust.
Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low altitude less snow than usual is lying. In the south-east of the region, watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the little recent snow.

tendency.highlights: The weather report and anticipated change in the avalanche danger are uncertain. We recommend that you consult the most recent avalanche bulletin.
